channel.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
channel.description:
Well, I'm pretty sure I'm the biggest HP fan here. I've been reading them since I was in 3rd grade, and I lost count of how many times I read the series, I know for sure at least 11 times. I'm waited outside at 12 AM for this book, and I totally just called first review on these forums. My review judging by it,
8/10
Review-
The book on the whole would probably be an 8/10. There was a lot of unanswered questions, but have to be expected considering the size of the series. The ending was a bit sketchy, as it left out details many needed, but all in all it was a great book. Hope you felt the same
It took a total of 14 hours to read, guess I got to be a better reader than I thought.
Sorry it took forever to review, when StarBlaster deleted all the HP topics I didn't think he'd put back the non-spoilers.

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

[quote=“Silver Lining, post:2, topic:116473”]It takes you 3-9 days to read a 784 page book?[/quote] lol, it only took me two days. And I just read it in my spare time (I was busy for about 16/2)

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @rspoon rspoon
item.description:
@rspoon wrote:

Gah, Im a HUGE Harry Potter fan. Ive been reading em since 2nd grade…My grandma got me the 4th one when I was really young…I could barely read. (I was like in kindergarten or 1st grade)

But my grandma isnt too bright.

Anyways, I liked the 7th book, I really got into it. But I HATED the 19 years later thing.

PS: Ive probably read the series around 8-12 times. I skip around sometimes.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Bobby:

I was referring to the putting of sex scenes in teen lit, not masturbation

Oh. Well, it would have made it more interesting. Imagines a shift from Rowling’s writing style to the people who write “erotic literature” on 7chan in the harry potter books.

Yes, it would definitely be more interesting to read. Hehe.

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Bobby, post:102, topic:116473”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=165745.msg1830748#msg1830748 date=1192778987]

I would have liked it better if Hermione has a passionate masturbation/lesbian sex scene which JK Rowling insisted would be in the movie. But you can never have what you want.

The former would be pretty hard to represent textually, wouldn’t it? Lol.
[/quote]

Not really its kinda of: disgusting/odd/confusing/not needed[/quote]

Masturbation isn’t “odd”, “confusing” or “not needed”, but it might disturb some younger readers, and I’d like to think that’s the only reason she didn’t put it in the book

Ah well.

Read full topic

anyway,i think it was a hige letdown that the epilogue was less than 10 pages. i htink around 70 would have been nice. some nice long wrapups.

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Yea, from reading it, it seems that Rowling kind of was short on time and just threw together some “suddenly the find the horcrux” parts, at least that’s what it was like for me, it seemed a bit strange.

The characters spent so much time looking for them and then all of the sudden they’ve magically found them, it just doesn’t make sense to me, like there’s not enough ‘flow’ to some parts.

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @Dregen Dregen
item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

[quote=“Bobby, post:91, topic:116473”]i read it fast cause i can’t read it slower. I have to try and read it slower, and that takes the fun out of reading for fun

For ANALyzing books ( I think you can tell how I feel about that) then read it slowly like three times. otherwise I skim the book like a dozen times. also i reread my books snce they are still good the second time.[/quote]

Oh, I see, lol. I guess you have a point.

Also, I think I’m going to reread it a second time too, but only after I finish “From the Corner of His Eye” by Dean Koontz. I’m like 3/4 through it, and it’s getting really good, so I should be done with it soon enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @Dregen Dregen
item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

Rating: 9/10

1 rating down because it was too short, lol.

Why would you guys read a book like this so fast? Take some time and enjoy it, lol. It took me about 12 hours to read, and I still regret having read it all in less than a week.

Good book, nice plot. The only book i can look forward to now is the last book of the Inheritance Trilogy, and then when I’m done with that… I’m not gonna have any good books to read -.-

Read full topic

i definetly can reread books like 3 times and still learn new things.

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Ugggh… Just because you don’t know how to skim doesn’t mean other people don’t, Buzzy. 3.3 pages per minute is easy if you’re skimming, and if you’re a good skimmer, you can pick up more from it than those that take their time reading it.

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:81, topic:116473”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=165745.msg1754645#msg1754645 date=1189733874]

it was a good book i read the first book 8 times woot also i read the 7th book in about 4 hours

That’s fucking bull. I read it in 8 hours. It’s almost 800 pages. You read 3.3 pages a minute?
[/quote]

yes i do im a very good reader[/quote]

Bullshit. I read it in about 14 hours accumulated, disregarding sleep and breaks, and that alone is something most won’t believe.

Your telling me that you read 20 words per minute? FUCKING BULLSHIT. But if lying to an online community makes you feel a little cooler about yourself, than your a fucking loser.

Read full topic

item.title: Harry Potter 7 -HA! I'm First
item.dc:creator: @tryed_to_hack_it tryed to hack it
item.description:
@tryed_to_hack_it wrote:

When I was 11, I scored like 12.9 on my Star Reading test, thats like college level (12th year 9th month)

I was a good reader but the way I did it is I skipped half the writing in a paragraph and just filled in the empty space with a word.

Plus i could type 55 wpm with 98% accuracy, using things like http://www.IKNOWHOWTOTYPE.com/7sghris883432
